title: Natalie Portman presented a new fruity-floral version of Miss Dior perfume
snippet: The face of Miss Dior Eau de Parfum, as before, is the actress Natalie Portman. For several years now she has embodied this delicate and sensual perfume. The shooting of the new ad campaign took place in Australia.

title: Allirajah Subaskaran new owner of Jaffna LPL franchise
snippet: The Winner of the inaugural edition of the Lanka Premier League (LPL) Jaffna Stallions have a new owner as Sri Lanka-born British entrepreneur, Allirajah Subaskaran, enters the second season of the premier T20 tournament of the Island Nation by acquiring the Jaffna-based franchise in the tournament.

title: Health equipment from UK

title: Sri Lankan cricketers begin training, to play three intra-squad games
snippet: The National cricket squad led by all-rounder Dasun Shanaka already commenced their gym and skill training sessions from last Friday 24th, having completed their mandatory three-day room quarantine they resumed their training focus on forthcoming ICC Men's T20 World Cup which scheduled to held UAE from October 17 to November 14.

title: Sri Lanka's Anuk Arudpragasam among the Booker's final shortlist
snippet: Anuk Arudpragasam, Damon Galgut, Patricia Lockwood, Nadifa Mohamed, Richard Powers and Maggie Shipstead are today announced as the six authors shortlisted for the 2021 Booker Prize for Fiction. title: Rice price controls removed to ensure supply
snippet: The Cabinet of Ministers has decided to remove the price control imposed on rice and import a buffer stock to prevent any possible shortage, Cabinet Spokesman and Mass Media Minister Dullas Alahapperuma said.

title: Questionable last will of late Miss Ceylon to be referred to Govt. Analyst

title: New owners for Jaffna franchise in LPL
snippet: Rex Clementine The winners of the inaugural Lanka Premier League - Jaffna Stallions have been shown the door after 'breach of contract' according to Sri Lanka Cricket and the ownership of the franchise has changed hands to UK based businessman Allirajah Subaskaran.

title: Sri Lanka shortages and blackmarkets not the actual intention of price controls: Minister
snippet: Sri Lanka is not issuing price control gazettes with the deliberate intention of creating shortages and black markets, Consumer Minister Lasantha Alagiyawanna said, after removing the latest ceiling prices on rice after sweeping disruptions in supply and distribution.

title: Government rolls back price controls on rice
snippet: The government this week decided to remove maximum retail prices (MRPs) imposed on rice with immediate effect and to import 100,000 metric tonnes of rice to address rice shortages in the market indicating a failure in price control measures.

title: Amãna Bank announces Rs.260mn scrip dividend
snippet: Continuing its divided journey and having just concluded 10 years of operations, Amãna Bank recently announced its fourth consecutive annual dividend by offering its shareholders an interim scrip dividend of 10 cents per share for the financial year 2021.

title: HNB offers higher returns for foreign currencies with FC Advantage
snippet: In a bid to encourage foreign currency account holders to save in designated currencies, Sri Lanka's most customer-centric private sector bank HNB PLC offered Foreign Currency Advantage (FC Advantage) savings account holders with higher returns.

title: Sri Lanka's apparel industry on tenterhooks over EU trade scrutiny
snippet: Sri Lanka's preferential trade access to the European Union, which is the biggest market for its US$ 5 billion apparel industry, is in doubt with an investigation into the island country's human rights and governance concerns set to start on Monday.

title: SL to set up National Road Safety Commission to reduce road accidents by 50%
snippet: As the country targets to reduce road accidents by 50 percent in five years under a new action plan, the government plans to complete the establishment of a National Road Safety Commission (NRSC) as the lead road safety authority within this year in order to facilitate smooth implementation of the action plan.

title: Cabinet nod to ban 20 new occupations including domestic services for minors
snippet: The Cabinet nod has been granted to add twenty new occupations including domestic services and jobs related to beauty culture to the list of hazardous jobs for minors (16-18 years) and to present the draft regulations to Parliament.

title: Exporters remain increasingly reluctant to repatriate and convert earnings: CB
snippet: Despite the requirement on 100 percent repatriation of export proceeds, exporters in an alarming trend have become more reluctant to convert export earnings driven by speculation on exchange rate movements and low rupee interest rates.

title: On-arrival PCR testing for tourists back at hotels
snippet: Sri Lanka will return to its previous system of carrying out the on-arrival PCR test at level -1 hotels, as the attempt to test tourists for COVID-19 at the airport premises itself failed to bring out the expected outcome.
